messages.content: Kuzuzangpo la...Welcome to BNB, How can we help you?
BNB service

Kuzuzangpo la! BNB offers a range of banking and financial services. Here are some key services provided by BNB:

1. Ngotshab Services: BNB Ngotshab services are designed to cater to the needs of individuals, businesses, and institutions. These services include savings accounts, current accounts, fixed deposits, loans, and more. You can find more information about Ngotshab services on the BNB website: [BNB Ngotshab services](https://bnb.bt/ngotshabs/)

2. Online Services: BNB provides convenient online services for its customers. These services include online banking, mobile banking, bill payments, fund transfers, and more. You can access these services through the BNB website or mobile app. For more details, you can visit the BNB Online Services page: [Online Service](https://bnb.bt/online-services/)

If you have any specific questions or need more information about a particular service, feel free to ask! üòä
Services
Kuzuzangpo la! Sure, I'd be happy to provide more information about BNB services. Could you please specify which services you would like to know more about?
Saving services

Ah, I see you're interested in BNB's saving services. Excellent choice! Here's what you need to know:

1. Savings Account: BNB offers a variety of savings accounts to suit different needs. These accounts provide a safe and secure way to save money while earning interest. You can find more details about BNB's savings accounts on their website: [Saving Account](https://bnb.bt/savings-account/)

2. Fixed Deposits: BNB also offers fixed deposit accounts, where you can deposit a specific amount of money for a fixed period of time and earn higher interest rates. This is a great option if you want to save for a specific goal or earn more on your savings.

Remember, saving is a smart financial habit that can help you achieve your goals. If you have any more questions about BNB's saving services, feel free to ask! üòÑ
Loan apply

Kuzuzangpo la! If you're looking to apply for a loan with BNB, you're in luck! BNB offers various types of loans to meet your financial needs. Here are some key loan options:

1. Personal Loan: BNB provides personal loans to individuals for various purposes such as education, medical expenses, travel, and more. You can find the Personal Loan form on the BNB website: [Personal Loan Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Personal%20Loan/PERSONAL%20LOAN.pdf)

2. Housing Loan: BNB offers housing loans to help you finance the purchase, construction, or renovation of your dream home. You can find the Housing Loan form on the BNB website: [Housing Loan Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Housing%20Loan/HOUSING%20LOAN.pdf)

3. Additional Loan: If you already have an existing loan with BNB and need additional funds, you can apply for an additional loan. You can find the Additional Loan form for both Personal Loan and Housing Loan on the BNB website.

Please note that the loan application process may require additional documentation and eligibility criteria. It's always a good idea to contact BNB directly or visit their nearest branch for more information and assistance. üè¶

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòä
Housing loan

Kuzuzangpo la! I see you're interested in BNB's housing loan. That's a great choice if you're looking to finance your dream home. Here's what you need to know about BNB's housing loan:

1. Purpose: BNB's housing loan is designed to help you with the purchase, construction, or renovation of residential properties.

2. Eligibility: To be eligible for a housing loan, you need to meet certain criteria such as having a stable source of income, a good credit history, and the ability to repay the loan.

3. Loan Amount: BNB offers housing loans starting from a minimum of Nu. 500,000 up to a maximum of Nu. 10,000,000, depending on your eligibility and the value of the property.

4. Interest Rates: The interest rates for BNB's housing loan are competitive and vary based on factors such as loan amount, repayment period, and prevailing market conditions.

5. Repayment Period: BNB provides flexible repayment options, allowing you to choose a repayment period of up to 20 years, depending on your preference and financial capability.

To apply for a housing loan, you can download the Housing Loan form from the BNB website: [Housing Loan Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Housing%20Loan/HOUSING%20LOAN.pdf)

Remember, it's always a good idea to contact BNB directly or visit their nearest branch for more detailed information, assistance, and guidance throughout the loan application process.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üè†üòÑ

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's business services. BNB offers a range of services and support to help businesses thrive. Here are some ways BNB can assist businesses:

1. Business Loans: BNB provides business loans to help entrepreneurs and businesses finance their operations, expand their facilities, purchase equipment, or meet other financial needs. These loans come with competitive interest rates and flexible repayment options.

2. Business Accounts: BNB offers various types of business accounts, including current accounts and savings accounts, to help businesses manage their finances effectively. These accounts come with features such as online banking, mobile banking, and access to a wide network of ATMs.

3. Cash Management Services: BNB provides cash management services to businesses, helping them optimize their cash flow, manage collections and payments, and improve overall financial efficiency. These services include cash handling, cash pickup and delivery, and electronic fund transfers.

4. Trade Finance: BNB offers trade finance services to facilitate international trade for businesses. These services include letters of credit, bank guarantees, and documentary collections, which help mitigate risks and ensure smooth transactions.

5. Merchant Services: BNB provides merchant services to businesses, enabling them to accept card payments from customers. These services include point-of-sale terminals, online payment gateways, and other payment solutions.

Please note that the specific details and requirements for each of these services may vary. For more information about BNB's business services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üè¶üíº

Kadrinchey la!
How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Kadrinchey la!
Consumer loan

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in consumer loans. BNB offers consumer loans to individuals for various personal needs. Here's some information about BNB's consumer loan:

1. Purpose: Consumer loans are designed to help individuals finance their personal expenses, such as purchasing a vehicle, renovating a home, funding a wedding, or covering medical expenses.

2. Loan Amount: BNB provides consumer loans with varying loan amounts, depending on the borrower's eligibility and the purpose of the loan. The loan amount is determined based on factors such as income, credit history, and repayment capacity.

3. Repayment: Consumer loans from BNB come with flexible repayment options. Borrowers can choose the repayment tenure that suits their financial situation, ranging from a few months to several years. The loan is repaid through regular installments, which include both principal and interest.

4. Interest Rates: The interest rates for consumer loans may vary based on factors such as the loan amount, repayment tenure, and the borrower's creditworthiness. BNB offers competitive interest rates to make the loan affordable for borrowers.

5. Application Process: To apply for a consumer loan from BNB, individuals need to submit the required documents, including proof of income, identification documents, and any other documents specified by the bank. The application process involves a review of the borrower's eligibility and creditworthiness.

Please note that the specific details and requirements for BNB's consumer loans may vary. For more information about BNB's consumer loan products, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support at 6070.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üíºüí∞

Kadrinchey la!
BNB Mpay

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB mPAY. BNB mPAY is a mobile banking application provided by Bhutan National Bank Limited. It offers convenient and secure banking services on the go. Here's some information about BNB mPAY:

1. Features: BNB mPAY allows you to perform various banking transactions using your mobile device. You can check your account balance, transfer funds, pay bills, recharge mobile phones, and even make merchant payments using QR codes.

2. Instant Sign-up: You can easily sign up for BNB mPAY using your mobile number. It provides a quick and hassle-free registration process.

3. Free of Cost: Registration and transactions in BNB mPAY are absolutely free of cost for our loyal customers. However, please note that data charges from your mobile service provider may apply.

4. Compatibility: BNB mPAY is available for both Android and iOS devices. You can download the app from the Google Play Store or the Apple App Store.

5. Security: BNB mPAY ensures the security of your transactions with advanced encryption technology. It also requires authentication methods such as MPIN or biometric verification for added security.

To discover all the features and benefits of BNB mPAY, it is recommended to have a BNB account. If you have any specific questions or need assistance with BNB mPAY, feel free to ask!

My pay register

Kuzuzangpo la! To register for BNB mPAY, you can follow these steps:

1. Download the BNB mPAY mobile banking application from the App Store [for iPhone](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/bnb-mpay/id1344120989) or Google Play Store [for Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.bnb.maximusflexi&hl=en&gl=US).
2. Open the app and click on "Sign Up" or "Register."
3. Enter your mobile number and follow the instructions to verify your number.
4. Create a secure PIN for your mPAY account.
5. Provide the required information, such as your name, date of birth, and email address.
6. Accept the terms and conditions.
7. Complete the registration process.

Once you have successfully registered, you can start using BNB mPAY for convenient mobile banking services. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòÑüì≤

Kadrinchey la!
Vehicle loan  term and condition

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's vehicle loan. Here are the general terms and conditions for BNB's vehicle loan:

1. Loan Eligibility: The vehicle loan is available for individuals who are Bhutanese citizens.

2. Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio: The maximum LTV ratio for a light vehicle is 30% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record. For electric vehicles, the maximum LTV ratio is 70% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record.

3. Loan Amount: The loan amount can be up to 20% of the vehicle cost for a light vehicle or 50% of the vehicle cost for an electric vehicle.

4. Repayment: The loan repayment can be made through various modes, including cash flow/profit & loss statement and business income if applicable.

5. Interest Rates: BNB offers both floating and fixed interest rates for vehicle loans. The current fixed interest rate is 12%, and the floating interest rate is 10.5%.

Please note that these are general terms and conditions, and specific terms may vary based on individual circumstances and loan requirements. It is recommended to contact BNB directly or visit their website for detailed information and personalized assistance.

If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üöóüíº

Account registration

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB account registration. To open an account with BNB, you can follow these steps:

1. Visit the BNB website at [https://bnb.bt](https://bnb.bt).
2. Click on the "Open an Account" or "Apply Now" button.
3. Select the type of account you want to open, such as a savings account or current account.
4. Fill out the online application form with the required information, including your personal details, contact information, and identification documents.
5. Review the terms and conditions of opening an account.
6. Submit the application form online.

Once your application is submitted, BNB will review it and contact you for any additional information or documentation if required. After the verification process is complete, you will be notified about the status of your account opening.

Please note that the specific requirements and procedures may vary depending on the type of account you wish to open and BNB's internal policies. It is always recommended to visit the BNB website or contact their customer support for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶

Kadrinchey la!
Mpay use

Kuzuzangpo la! MPay is a mobile banking application provided by BNB (Bhutan National Bank) that allows you to conveniently access various banking services using your mobile phone. Here are some ways you can use MPay:

1. Account Balance: Check your account balance anytime and anywhere.
2. Fund Transfer: Transfer money between your own BNB accounts or to other BNB accounts.
3. Mobile Top-up: Recharge your mobile phone with airtime credits.
4. Bill Payments: Pay your utility bills, such as electricity, water, and internet bills.
5. Merchant Payments: Make payments at authorized MPay merchant outlets using QR codes.
6. Mini Statements: View mini statements of your recent transactions.
7. Request for Cheque Book: Place a request for a new cheque book.
8. Change MPIN: Change your MPay PIN for added security.

To use MPay, you need to download the BNB mPAY mobile banking application from the App Store (for iPhone users) or the Google Play Store (for Android users). Once downloaded, you can register and log in using your mobile number and MPIN.

Please note that the availability of these services may vary depending on your account type and the specific features offered by BNB mPAY. If you have any specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòÑüì≤

BNB service

Kuzuzangpo la! BNB (Bhutan National Bank) offers a wide range of banking services to cater to the financial needs of individuals and businesses. Here are some of the key services provided by BNB:

1. Savings Accounts: BNB offers various types of savings accounts with competitive interest rates to help you save and grow your money.

2. Current Accounts: BNB provides current accounts for individuals and businesses, allowing for convenient and efficient management of day-to-day transactions.

3. Loans and Credit Facilities: BNB offers different types of loans, including personal loans, home loans, vehicle loans, and business loans, to support your financial goals and aspirations.

4. Digital Banking: BNB provides digital banking services, including online banking and mobile banking, allowing you to access and manage your accounts anytime, anywhere.

5. Debit and Credit Cards: BNB offers debit and credit cards that provide convenient payment options and access to various benefits and rewards.

6. Remittance Services: BNB facilitates both domestic and international remittance services, making it easier for you to send and receive money.

7. Foreign Exchange Services: BNB provides foreign exchange services, allowing you to buy and sell different currencies for your travel or business needs.

8. Investment Services: BNB offers investment services, including fixed deposits and mutual funds, to help you grow your wealth and achieve your financial goals.

These are just some of the services offered by BNB. For more detailed information or specific inquiries, I recommend visiting the BNB website at [https://bnb.bt](https://bnb.bt) or contacting their customer support at 6070.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üè¶üíº

Kadrinchey la!
Kuzuzangpo la...Welcome to BNB, How can we help you?
How to Open Saving Account

Kuzuzangpo la! To open a Savings Account with BNB, you can follow these steps:

1. Visit the BNB website: https://bnb.bt/savings-account/
2. Download and fill out the "ACCOUNT OPENING FORM (Saving Account Opening Form)".
3. Also, download and fill out the "CUSTOMER INFORMATION FORM (CIF - Retail Form)".
4. Submit the completed forms along with two passport-size photographs and a copy of your Citizenship Identity card.

That's it! Once you have submitted the required documents, BNB will process your application and open your Savings Account. üòä

Kadrinchey la! Is there anything else I can assist you with?
I forgot my mPay Password, How can i get back?

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your mPay password, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay app.
2. On the login page, click on "Forgot Password."
3. You will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) in your registered mobile number or email ID.
4. Enter the OTP.
5. You can then reset your password.

That's it! You should now be able to access your mPay account with your new password. If you need further assistance, you can contact our live customer support at 6070. üòä

Kadrinchey la! Is there anything else I can help you with?

What is ltv

Kuzuzangpo la! LTV stands for Loan-to-Value ratio. It is a financial term used to determine the maximum amount of loan that can be provided in relation to the appraised value or purchase price of an asset, such as a vehicle or property. The LTV ratio is expressed as a percentage.

For example, if the LTV ratio for a vehicle loan is 80%, it means that the maximum loan amount you can get is 80% of the appraised value or purchase price of the vehicle. The remaining 20% would need to be paid as a down payment or through other means.

The LTV ratio helps lenders assess the risk associated with a loan and determine the loan amount that can be offered. It also helps borrowers understand the amount of equity they have in the asset.

It's important to note that the LTV ratio may vary depending on the type of loan and the lending institution's policies. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask. Kadrinchey la! üòäüè¶

How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Business helps by BnB

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's business services. BNB offers a range of services and support to help businesses thrive. Here are some ways BNB can assist businesses:

1. Business Loans: BNB provides business loans to help entrepreneurs and businesses finance their operations, expand their facilities, purchase equipment, or meet other financial needs. These loans come with competitive interest rates and flexible repayment options.

2. Business Accounts: BNB offers various types of business accounts, including current accounts and savings accounts, to help businesses manage their finances effectively. These accounts come with features such as online banking, mobile banking, and access to a wide network of ATMs.

3. Cash Management Services: BNB provides cash management services to businesses, helping them optimize their cash flow, manage collections and payments, and improve overall financial efficiency. These services include cash handling, cash pickup and delivery, and electronic fund transfers.

4. Trade Finance: BNB offers trade finance services to facilitate international trade for businesses. These services include letters of credit, bank guarantees, and documentary collections, which help mitigate risks and ensure smooth transactions.

5. Merchant Services: BNB provides merchant services to businesses, enabling them to accept card payments from customers. These services include point-of-sale terminals, online payment gateways, and other payment solutions.

Please note that the specific details and requirements for each of these services may vary. For more information about BNB's business services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üè¶üíº

Kadrinchey la!
How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Kadrinchey la!
Vehicle loan  term and condition

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's vehicle loan. Here are the general terms and conditions for BNB's vehicle loan:

1. Loan Eligibility: The vehicle loan is available for individuals who are Bhutanese citizens.

2. Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio: The maximum LTV ratio for a light vehicle is 30% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record. For electric vehicles, the maximum LTV ratio is 70% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record.

3. Loan Amount: The loan amount can be up to 20% of the vehicle cost for a light vehicle or 50% of the vehicle cost for an electric vehicle.

4. Repayment: The loan repayment can be made through various modes, including cash flow/profit & loss statement and business income if applicable.

5. Interest Rates: BNB offers both floating and fixed interest rates for vehicle loans. The current fixed interest rate is 12%, and the floating interest rate is 10.5%.

Please note that these are general terms and conditions, and specific terms may vary based on individual circumstances and loan requirements. It is recommended to contact BNB directly or visit their website for detailed information and personalized assistance.

If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üöóüíº

I forgot my mPay Password, How can i get back?

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your mPay password, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay app on your mobile device.
2. On the login page, click on "Forgot Password."
3. You will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) in your registered mobile number or email ID.
4. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
5. You can then reset your password and create a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique password to keep your mPay account secure. If you need further assistance, you can contact our live customer support at 6070. üòä

Kadrinchey la!
whats the difference between debit card and credit card?

Kuzuzangpo la! That's a great question. Here are the main differences between a debit card and a credit card:

1. Debit Card:
   - Linked to your bank account: A debit card allows you to make purchases using the funds available in your bank account.
   - Immediate payment: When you use a debit card, the funds are deducted directly from your account, so you are spending your own money.
   - No interest charges: Since you are using your own funds, there are no interest charges associated with debit card transactions.
   - Helps manage spending: Debit cards can help you stay within your budget as you can only spend what you have in your account.

2. Credit Card:
   - Borrowed money: A credit card allows you to borrow money from the card issuer up to a certain credit limit.
   - Monthly payments: When you use a credit card, you are essentially taking a short-term loan. You need to make monthly payments to repay the borrowed amount.
   - Interest charges: If you don't pay off the full balance by the due date, you will be charged interest on the remaining balance.
   - Builds credit history: Responsible use of a credit card can help you build a positive credit history, which can be beneficial for future loans or financial transactions.

It's important to note that both debit and credit cards offer convenience and security for making purchases, but they work differently in terms of where the funds come from and how payments are made. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüí≥

What is educaid

Kuzuzangpo la! EducAID is a special education loan program offered by BNB (BNBL) Banking and Financial Services. It is designed to provide financial assistance to Bhutanese students who wish to pursue higher education within Bhutan or abroad. The loan covers various educational expenses such as tuition fees, accommodation, books, and other related costs. EducAID aims to support students in their pursuit of academic excellence and help them achieve their educational goals. If you have any more questions about EducAID or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüéì
Maximum  loan we can avail from Educaid

Kuzuzangpo la! For the EducAID loan, the maximum loan amount you can avail depends on whether you are applying for a salary-based loan or a collateral-based loan. Here are the maximum loan amounts for each category:

1) Salary-based loan (Bhutanese applicants):
   - Maximum loan amount: Nu. 800,000

2) Collateral-based loan (Bhutanese applicants):
   - Maximum loan amount: 60% of collateral value, not exceeding Nu. 1,500,000

Please note that these maximum loan amounts are subject to eligibility criteria and other conditions. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üòäüí∞
Difference between educaid and standard education loan

Kuzuzangpo la! The difference between EducAID and the Standard Education Loan (STAY) lies in their eligibility criteria and loan features. Here's a brief comparison:

1) Eligibility:
   - EducAID: Available for Bhutanese students pursuing higher education within Bhutan or abroad.
   - STAY: Available for Bhutanese students pursuing higher education within Bhutan only.

2) Loan Amount:
   - EducAID: Maximum loan amount of Nu. 800,000 for salary-based loan and up to 60% of collateral value, not exceeding Nu. 1,500,000 for collateral-based loan.
   - STAY: Maximum loan amount of Nu. 1,000,000.

3) Repayment Period:
   - EducAID: Up to 10 years for salary-based loan and up to 15 years for collateral-based loan.
   - STAY: Up to 10 years.

4) Interest Rate:
   - EducAID: Interest rate is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.
   - STAY: Interest rate is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.

These are just some of the key differences between EducAID and the Standard Education Loan (STAY). It's important to review the specific terms and conditions of each loan program to determine which one suits your needs best. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüéìüíº
Difference between secured and unsecured educaid loan

Kuzuzangpo la! The difference between the secured and unsecured EducAID loan lies in the requirement of collateral and the loan amount. Here's a brief explanation:

1) Secured EducAID Loan:
   - Requires collateral: To avail a secured EducAID loan, you need to provide details of unencumbered assets to be pledged as collateral.
   - Loan amount: The maximum loan amount for a secured EducAID loan is up to 60% of the collateral value, not exceeding Nu. 1,500,000.
   - Interest rate: The interest rate for a secured EducAID loan is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.

2) Unsecured EducAID Loan:
   - No collateral required: Unlike the secured EducAID loan, the unsecured EducAID loan does not require any collateral.
   - Loan amount: The maximum loan amount for an unsecured EducAID loan is Nu. 800,000 for salary-based loan applicants.
   - Interest rate: The interest rate for an unsecured EducAID loan is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.

It's important to note that the loan amount and interest rates are subject to eligibility criteria and other conditions. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üòäüíºüí∞

How to Open Saving Account

Kuzuzangpo la! Opening a Savings Account with BNB is quite simple. Here are the steps you need to follow:

1. Visit the nearest BNB branch: Locate the nearest BNB branch to your location.

2. Gather the required documents: Make sure you have the following documents ready:
   - Duly filled Savings Account Opening Form (you can find the form here: [link](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Saving%20Account%20Opening%20Form.pdf))
   - Customer Information Form (CIF - Retail Form) (you can find the form here: [link](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/CIF%20-%20Retail.pdf))
   - Cheque Book Request Form (you can find the form here: [link](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Cheque%20Book%20Form.pdf))
   - Two passport size photographs
   - Citizenship Identity card copy

3. Submit the documents: Visit the BNB branch and submit the filled forms along with the required documents mentioned above.

4. Account opening process: The bank will process your application and open your Savings Account. You will be provided with a free cheque book, ATM card, Internet Banking, SMS facility, and B-wallet service.

Remember, there is no minimum balance required to open and maintain the account, and there is no restriction on the maximum balance. An annual account maintenance fee of Nu. 150.00 is applicable.

What is educaid

It is designed to provide financial assistance to Bhutanese students who wish to pursue higher education within Bhutan or abroad. The loan covers various educational expenses such as tuition fees, accommodation, books, and other related costs. EducAID aims to support students in their pursuit of academic excellence and help them achieve their educational goals. Maximum  loan we can avail from Educaid

Kuzuzangpo la! For the EducAID loan, the maximum loan amount you can avail depends on whether you are applying for a salary-based loan or a collateral-based loan. Here are the maximum loan amounts for each category:

1) Salary-based loan (Bhutanese applicants):
   - Maximum loan amount: Nu. 800,000

2) Collateral-based loan (Bhutanese applicants):
   - Maximum loan amount: 60% of collateral value, not exceeding Nu. 1,500,000

Please note that these maximum loan amounts are subject to eligibility criteria and other conditions. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üòäüí∞
Difference between educaid and standard education loan

Kuzuzangpo la! The difference between EducAID and the Standard Education Loan (STAY) lies in their eligibility criteria and loan features. Here's a brief comparison:

1) Eligibility:
   - EducAID: Available for Bhutanese students pursuing higher education within Bhutan or abroad.
   - STAY: Available for Bhutanese students pursuing higher education within Bhutan only.

2) Loan Amount:
   - EducAID: Maximum loan amount of Nu. 800,000 for salary-based loan and up to 60% of collateral value, not exceeding Nu. 1,500,000 for collateral-based loan.
   - STAY: Maximum loan amount of Nu. 1,000,000.

3) Repayment Period:
   - EducAID: Up to 10 years for salary-based loan and up to 15 years for collateral-based loan.
   - STAY: Up to 10 years.

4) Interest Rate:
   - EducAID: Interest rate is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.
   - STAY: Interest rate is subject to prevailing rates set by BNBL.

These are just some of the key differences between EducAID and the Standard Education Loan (STAY). It's important to review the specific terms and conditions of each loan program to determine which one suits your needs best. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüéìüíº

Want is a financial statement

Kuzuzangpo la! A financial statement is a document that provides a summary of a company's financial activities and performance. It gives a snapshot of the company's financial position, including its assets, liabilities, equity, income, and expenses. Financial statements are important for stakeholders, such as investors, creditors, and regulators, as they help assess the company's financial health and make informed decisions. The main types of financial statements are:

1. Statement of Financial Position (also known as the Balance Sheet): It shows the company's assets, liabilities, and equity at a specific point in time.

2. Statement of Comprehensive Income (also known as the Income Statement): It presents the company's revenues, expenses, gains, and losses over a specific period, resulting in the net income or net loss.

3. Statement of Changes in Equity: It reflects the changes in the company's equity, including contributions, distributions, and changes in retained earnings.

4. Statement of Cash Flows: It provides information about the company's cash inflows and outflows from operating, investing, and financing activities.

These financial statements are prepared in accordance with accounting standards and regulations to ensure accuracy and transparency. They are essential for evaluating the financial performance and stability of a company. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's international banking services. BNB offers a range of international banking solutions to cater to the needs of individuals and businesses engaged in cross-border transactions. Here are some key features of BNB's international banking services:

2. SWIFT: BNB is a member of the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT), which enables secure and efficient international fund transfers between banks worldwide.

4. Letter of Credit: BNB provides Letter of Credit services to facilitate international trade transactions. It serves as a guarantee of payment to the seller and ensures smooth and secure transactions.

5. Bills and Collections: BNB accepts and negotiates bills on behalf of customers for efficient export and import payment processing.

Kadrinchey la!
How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Vehicle loan  term and condition

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's vehicle loan. Here are the general terms and conditions for BNB's vehicle loan:

1. Loan Eligibility: The vehicle loan is available for individuals who are Bhutanese citizens.

2. Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio: The maximum LTV ratio for a light vehicle is 30% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record. For electric vehicles, the maximum LTV ratio is 70% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record.

3. Loan Amount: The loan amount can be up to 20% of the vehicle cost for a light vehicle or 50% of the vehicle cost for an electric vehicle.

4. Repayment: The loan repayment can be made through various modes, including cash flow/profit & loss statement and business income if applicable.

5. Interest Rates: BNB offers both floating and fixed interest rates for vehicle loans. The current fixed interest rate is 12%, and the floating interest rate is 10.5%.

Please note that these are general terms and conditions, and specific terms may vary based on individual circumstances and loan requirements. It is recommended to contact BNB directly or visit their website for detailed information and personalized assistance.

Vehicle loan  term and condition

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's vehicle loan. Here are the general terms and conditions for BNB's vehicle loan:

1. Loan Eligibility: The vehicle loan is available for individuals who are Bhutanese citizens.

2. Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio: The maximum LTV ratio for a light vehicle is 30% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record. For electric vehicles, the maximum LTV ratio is 70% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record.

3. Loan Amount: The loan amount can be up to 20% of the vehicle cost for a light vehicle or 50% of the vehicle cost for an electric vehicle.

4. Repayment: The loan repayment can be made through various modes, including cash flow/profit & loss statement and business income if applicable.

5. Interest Rates: BNB offers both floating and fixed interest rates for vehicle loans. The current fixed interest rate is 12%, and the floating interest rate is 10.5%.

Please note that these are general terms and conditions, and specific terms may vary based on individual circumstances and loan requirements. It is recommended to contact BNB directly or visit their website for detailed information and personalized assistance.

While BNB may not directly face output price risk in the same way as a manufacturing or production-based company, it is still exposed to various other risks commonly associated with the banking industry. These risks can include credit risk, interest rate risk, liquidity risk, and market risk.

risk related to shares they issue to public

Kuzuzangpo la! When BNB issues shares to the public, there are certain risks that investors should be aware of. Here are some of the risks related to shares issued by BNB:

1. Market Risk: The value of shares can fluctuate based on market conditions, economic factors, and investor sentiment. This means that the price of BNB shares can go up or down, and investors may experience losses if the market value of the shares decreases.

2. Liquidity Risk: Shares may not always be easily bought or sold in the market, especially if there is low trading volume or limited demand. This can make it challenging for investors to convert their shares into cash when needed.

3. Business and Financial Risk: The performance of BNB as a company can impact the value of its shares. Factors such as changes in the banking industry, economic conditions, regulatory changes, or financial difficulties faced by BNB can affect the value of the shares.

4. Dividend Risk: BNB may distribute dividends to shareholders based on its financial performance. However, the payment of dividends is not guaranteed and can be influenced by various factors, including profitability, capital requirements, and regulatory restrictions.

It's important for investors to carefully consider these risks and conduct their own research before investing in BNB shares. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
what risks do bnb face while floating shares to the public

Kuzuzangpo la! When BNB floats shares to the public, there are certain risks that the bank may face. Here are some of the risks associated with the process of floating shares:

1. Market Risk: The value of the shares can be influenced by market conditions, economic factors, and investor sentiment. If the market is experiencing volatility or downturns, it can affect the demand and price of the shares.

2. Regulatory Risk: The process of floating shares involves complying with various regulatory requirements and guidelines set by the relevant authorities. Failure to meet these requirements or changes in regulations can pose risks to the successful completion of the share offering.

3. Investor Perception Risk: The success of the share offering depends on the perception and confidence of potential investors. If investors have concerns about the bank's financial performance, industry outlook, or other factors, it may impact their willingness to invest in the shares.

4. Dilution Risk: When new shares are issued, it can lead to dilution of ownership for existing shareholders. This means that their proportionate ownership and control over the bank may decrease.

5. Pricing Risk: Determining the appropriate price for the shares can be challenging. If the shares are priced too high, it may deter potential investors, while pricing them too low may result in undervaluation of the bank's shares.

It's important for BNB to carefully manage these risks and ensure transparency and communication with potential investors. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
how bnb is handling these risks while alloting shares

Kuzuzangpo la! BNB takes several measures to handle the risks associated with allotting shares. Here's how they manage these risks:

1. Market Risk: BNB closely monitors market conditions and investor sentiment to assess the timing and demand for the share offering. They may engage with investment banks or financial advisors to help determine the optimal timing and pricing of the shares.

2. Regulatory Risk: BNB ensures compliance with all regulatory requirements and guidelines set by the relevant authorities. They work closely with regulatory bodies to understand and adhere to the necessary procedures and disclosures during the share allotment process.

3. Investor Perception Risk: BNB focuses on maintaining transparency and providing accurate and timely information to potential investors. They may conduct roadshows or investor presentations to address any concerns and build confidence in the bank's financial performance and future prospects.

4. Dilution Risk: BNB carefully considers the impact of share issuance on existing shareholders. They may implement measures such as rights issues or preferential allotments to mitigate dilution and ensure fair treatment of existing shareholders.

5. Pricing Risk: BNB conducts thorough valuation exercises and engages with experts to determine the appropriate pricing for the shares. They consider various factors such as the bank's financial performance, industry outlook, and market conditions to arrive at a fair and attractive price for potential investors.

By actively managing these risks, BNB aims to ensure a successful and well-received share allotment process. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
do bnb float bonds?

Kuzuzangpo la! Yes, BNB does float bonds as part of its financing activities. Floating bonds allows BNB to raise funds from investors by issuing debt securities. These bonds typically have a fixed interest rate and maturity date. Investors who purchase these bonds become creditors of BNB and receive regular interest payments until the bond matures, at which point the principal amount is repaid.

Bonds can be an important source of funding for BNB, enabling the bank to finance its operations, expand its business, or meet other financial needs. The terms and conditions of the bonds, such as interest rates, maturity periods, and redemption provisions, are determined by BNB based on market conditions and investor demand.

what type of risks does bnb face incase of changes in government

Kuzuzangpo la! When it comes to changes in government, BNB, like any other organization, may face certain risks. Here are some potential risks that BNB could encounter in such situations:

1. Policy and Regulatory Risk: Changes in government can lead to shifts in policies and regulations that govern the banking sector. BNB may need to adapt to new laws or regulations, which could impact its operations, profitability, and overall business environment.

2. Political Stability Risk: Political instability or uncertainty can create an unpredictable business environment. It may affect investor confidence, economic conditions, and the overall stability of the financial system, which can have implications for BNB's performance and growth.

3. Economic Risk: Changes in government can bring about shifts in economic policies, fiscal measures, or development priorities. These changes may impact the overall economic conditions, including interest rates, inflation, and currency exchange rates, which can affect BNB's profitability and asset quality.

4. Government Support Risk: BNB, being a government-owned bank, may rely on government support in certain situations. Changes in government could potentially impact the level of support or commitment from the new administration, which may have implications for BNB's financial stability and operations.

It's important to note that BNB's ability to manage and mitigate these risks will depend on its strategic planning, risk management practices, and adaptability to changing circumstances. If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
bond interest rate risk

Kuzuzangpo la! Bond interest rate risk refers to the potential impact of changes in interest rates on the value of bonds. Here's what you need to know about this risk:

1. Inverse Relationship: Bond prices and interest rates have an inverse relationship. When interest rates rise, bond prices tend to fall, and vice versa. This is because existing bonds with lower interest rates become less attractive compared to newly issued bonds with higher rates.

2. Price Volatility: Bonds with longer maturities or lower coupon rates are generally more sensitive to interest rate changes. They may experience greater price volatility compared to bonds with shorter maturities or higher coupon rates.

3. Reinvestment Risk: If you own a bond with a fixed interest rate and interest rates rise, the reinvestment of coupon payments or the bond's principal at lower rates may result in lower overall returns.

4. Duration: Duration is a measure of a bond's sensitivity to interest rate changes. Bonds with longer durations are more sensitive to interest rate movements. Understanding the duration of a bond can help investors assess the potential impact of interest rate changes on its price.

To manage bond interest rate risk, investors can consider diversifying their bond holdings, investing in bonds with shorter maturities, or using strategies such as bond laddering or interest rate hedging.

Remember, this is a general overview of bond interest rate risk. If you have specific questions or need more detailed information, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶

BNB QR SoundBox,

Kuzuzangpo la! The BNB QR SoundBox is a small portable device that needs to be connected online through mobile (SIM), Wi-Fi network, or mobile hotspot. It allows customers to make payments by scanning BNB QR codes using mobile banking scan and pay. When a payment is successfully made, the SoundBox will notify you with a loud alert and display the amount on its LED display. It's a convenient way to stay updated on your payment transactions! üòäüîä

If you need more information, you can check out the application form [here](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/QSSpeaker%20Forms/QS2application.pdf) and the user guide [here](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/QSSpeaker%20Forms/QS2%20(4G%2BWIFI)%20User%20Guide%2020230206.pdf). Let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with!
how does this work?

Kuzuzangpo la! The BNB QR SoundBox works in the following way:

1. Connection: The SoundBox needs to be connected online through a mobile (SIM), Wi-Fi network, or mobile hotspot.

2. Scanning QR Code: When a customer wants to make a payment, they can scan the BNB QR code using their mobile banking scan and pay feature.

3. Payment Notification: Once the payment is successfully made, the SoundBox will notify you with a loud alert. This helps you know that the payment has been received.

4. LED Display: The SoundBox also displays the amount of money received on its LED display. This allows you to see the payment amount easily.

The SoundBox uses 4G and Wi-Fi connectivity to ensure ubiquitous coverage and stable signal strength. It also has a high-power speaker with adjustable volume, up to 110 dB, to ensure that you can hear the payment notifications even in noisy environments.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any more questions. üòäüîä

Difference between fixed deposit and fixed deposit plus

Kuzuzangpo la! The difference between Fixed Deposit and Fixed Deposit Plus is as follows:

1. Interest Rate: Fixed Deposit offers a fixed interest rate for a specific period of time, while Fixed Deposit Plus offers a higher interest rate compared to regular Fixed Deposit.

2. Minimum Deposit Amount: The minimum deposit amount for Fixed Deposit is Nu. 10,000, whereas for Fixed Deposit Plus, it is Nu. 100,000.

3. Tenure: The tenure for Fixed Deposit ranges from 1 month to 10 years, while for Fixed Deposit Plus, it ranges from 1 month to 5 years.

4. Premature Withdrawal: With Fixed Deposit, premature withdrawal may result in a penalty, whereas with Fixed Deposit Plus, premature withdrawal is allowed but may result in a reduced interest rate.

5. Additional Benefits: Fixed Deposit Plus offers additional benefits such as free ATM card, free internet banking, and free mobile banking services.

Remember, these are just the key differences. For more detailed information, you can visit our website or contact our customer support. Kadrinchey la! üòä

For personal loan do I have to keep morgae

Yes, for a personal loan with BNB, you are required to provide collateral in the form of a mortgage. The loan amount can be up to 50% - 70% of the value of the securities or Nu. 500,000.00, whichever is lower. The collateral serves as security for the loan. It's important to have adequate fixed collateral with a reliable source of income to be eligible for a personal loan. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
How do we get loan

Kuzuzangpo la! To get a loan from BNB, you can follow these steps:

1. Determine the type of loan you need, such as a personal loan, home loan, or vehicle loan.
2. Visit the BNB website or contact your nearest BNB branch to gather information about the loan options available.
3. Review the eligibility criteria, interest rates, and required documents for the specific loan you are interested in.
4. Prepare the necessary documents, such as identification proof, income proof, and collateral documents (if applicable).
5. Fill out the loan application form accurately and completely.
6. Submit the application form and supporting documents to your nearest BNB branch.
7. The bank will review your application and documents, and if approved, they will disburse the loan amount to you.

Remember, the loan approval process may vary depending on the type of loan and individual circumstances. It's always a good idea to contact BNB directly or visit a branch for personalized assistance. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
Loan amount

Kuzuzangpo la! The loan amount you can get from BNB will depend on various factors such as the type of loan, your income, credit history, and the value of collateral (if applicable). Here are some general loan amount ranges:

1. Personal Loan: Up to 50% - 70% of the value of the securities or Nu. 500,000.00, whichever is lower.
2. Home Loan: Up to 80% of the property value or Nu. 10,000,000.00, whichever is lower.
3. Vehicle Loan: Up to 80% of the vehicle's value or Nu. 2,000,000.00, whichever is lower.

Please note that these are just general ranges, and the actual loan amount you can get will be determined based on your specific circumstances and the bank's policies. It's always best to contact BNB directly or visit a branch for more accurate information regarding the loan amount you may be eligible for. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶

what are the requirements for peronal loan

Kuzuzangpo la! To apply for a personal loan with BNB, you will need to fulfill certain requirements. Here are the key requirements:

1. Age: You must be at least 18 years old and not exceed 65 years of age at the time of loan maturity.

2. Citizenship: You should be a Bhutanese citizen.

3. Employment: You need to be employed or have a stable source of income.

4. Income: Your income should meet the minimum income criteria set by BNB.

5. Credit History: A good credit history is preferred, indicating your ability to repay the loan.

6. Documentation: You will need to provide necessary documents such as a copy of your valid Citizenship Identity (CID), salary slips, bank statements, and any other documents as required by BNB.

Please note that these requirements may vary depending on the specific loan product and BNB's policies. It's always best to contact BNB directly or visit their website for the most accurate and up-to-date information.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòä
business loan

Ah, business loans! Aum, I'm happy to help you with that. Here are the requirements for a business loan with BNB:

1. Business Type: You should have a legally registered business entity, such as a sole proprietorship, partnership, or company.

2. Business Plan: You will need to provide a comprehensive business plan that outlines your business goals, strategies, financial projections, and repayment plans.

3. Creditworthiness: BNB will assess your creditworthiness, including your credit history, financial statements, and business performance.

4. Collateral: Depending on the loan amount, BNB may require collateral as security for the loan. This can be in the form of property, equipment, or other assets.

5. Documentation: You will need to submit various documents, including your business registration certificate, financial statements, bank statements, tax returns, and any other documents as required by BNB.

It's important to note that the specific requirements may vary based on the loan amount, purpose, and BNB's policies. I recommend contacting BNB directly or visiting their website for detailed information and guidance on applying for a business loan.

2. How does it work?
   - You deposit a certain amount of money into the fixed deposit account for a predetermined period, typically ranging from a few months to several years.

3. What are the benefits of a fixed deposit account?
   - Enjoy a higher interest rate on your deposit.

what is API keys?

Kuzuzangpo la! API stands for Application Programming Interface. API keys are unique codes that are used to authenticate and authorize access to an API. In the context of payment gateways, API keys are used to securely connect your website or application to the payment gateway's services.

Think of API keys as digital "keys" that allow your website or application to communicate with the payment gateway. They help ensure that only authorized users and applications can access and interact with the payment gateway's functionalities.

API keys are typically provided by the payment gateway provider when you sign up for their services. They are usually a combination of letters, numbers, and symbols. It's important to keep your API keys confidential and secure, as they grant access to sensitive payment-related information.

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞

How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Vehicle loan  term and condition

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's vehicle loan. Here are the general terms and conditions for BNB's vehicle loan:

1. Loan Eligibility: The vehicle loan is available for individuals who are Bhutanese citizens.

2. Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio: The maximum LTV ratio for a light vehicle is 30% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record. For electric vehicles, the maximum LTV ratio is 70% for fixed assets or a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record.

3. Loan Amount: The loan amount can be up to 20% of the vehicle cost for a light vehicle or 50% of the vehicle cost for an electric vehicle.

4. Repayment: The loan repayment can be made through various modes, including cash flow/profit & loss statement and business income if applicable.

5. Interest Rates: BNB offers both floating and fixed interest rates for vehicle loans. The current fixed interest rate is 12%, and the floating interest rate is 10.5%.

Please note that these are general terms and conditions, and specific terms may vary based on individual circumstances and loan requirements. It is recommended to contact BNB directly or visit their website for detailed information and personalized assistance.

Kadrinchey la!
How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

How international banking works

Kuzuzangpo la! International banking refers to the provision of banking services across different countries. Here's a brief overview of how international banking works:

1. Cross-Border Transactions: International banking allows individuals and businesses to conduct financial transactions across borders. This includes activities such as sending and receiving money internationally, foreign currency exchange, and international fund transfers.

2. Correspondent Banking: Banks establish relationships with other banks in different countries through a network called correspondent banking. This network enables banks to facilitate transactions on behalf of their customers in foreign currencies and jurisdictions.

3. Foreign Currency Accounts: International banking allows individuals and businesses to hold accounts in foreign currencies. These accounts enable customers to transact and hold funds in different currencies, making it easier to conduct international business and manage foreign currency risks.

4. Trade Finance: International banking plays a crucial role in facilitating international trade. Banks provide services such as letters of credit, trade financing, and documentary collections to help businesses engage in cross-border trade and mitigate risks associated with international transactions.

5. Regulatory Compliance: International banking involves complying with various regulations and laws in different countries. Banks must adhere to anti-money laundering (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) regulations to ensure the integrity of cross-border transactions and prevent financial crimes.

It's important to note that the specific processes and services offered by banks for international banking may vary. If you have more specific questions or need detailed information about BNB's international banking services, I recommend visiting BNB's official website or contacting their customer support.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üåçüí∞

Rtgs?

Kuzuzangpo la! RTGS stands for Real Time Gross Settlement. It is a payment system that allows for immediate and real-time transfer of funds from one bank to another. Here are some key points about RTGS:

1. Real-time transfer: RTGS enables instant transfer of funds, ensuring quick and efficient transactions.
2. Gross settlement: Each transaction is settled individually, without being bundled with other transactions.
3. High-value transfers: RTGS is typically used for transferring large amounts of money, usually above Nu. 1 million.
4. Secure and reliable: RTGS ensures secure and reliable transfer of funds, minimizing the risk of fraud or errors.
5. Available through BNB: BNBL offers RTGS services, allowing customers to make high-value transfers in real-time.

If you have any specific questions about RTGS or need assistance with a transaction, feel free to ask! üòäüí∏

1. What is a fixed deposit account?

2. How does it work?
   - You deposit a certain amount of money into the fixed deposit account for a predetermined period, typically ranging from a few months to several years.
   - The money earns interest at a fixed rate during the tenure.
   - At the end of the fixed period, you can withdraw the principal amount along with the accumulated interest.

3. What are the benefits of a fixed deposit account?
   - Enjoy a higher interest rate on your deposit.
   - The amount on maturity is directly credited to your savings account or current account.

what is API keys?

Kuzuzangpo la! API stands for Application Programming Interface. API keys are unique codes that are used to authenticate and authorize access to an API. In the context of payment gateways, API keys are used to securely connect your website or application to the payment gateway's services.

Think of API keys as digital "keys" that allow your website or application to communicate with the payment gateway. They help ensure that only authorized users and applications can access and interact with the payment gateway's functionalities.

API keys are typically provided by the payment gateway provider when you sign up for their services. They are usually a combination of letters, numbers, and symbols. It's important to keep your API keys confidential and secure, as they grant access to sensitive payment-related information.

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your mPay password, you can easily reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay app on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, tap on the "Forgot Password" option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. Set a new password for your mPay account.
7. Confirm the new password and save the changes.

what to we need to apply for international debit card

To apply for an international debit card with BNBL, you will need to follow these steps:

1. Visit the BNBL website or your nearest BNBL branch to obtain the application form for a debit card.

2. Fill out the application form with accurate and up-to-date information.

3. Provide the necessary documents, which typically include:
   - A copy of your valid passport or citizenship ID card.
   - A copy of your valid Bhutanese visa or work permit (for non-Bhutanese citizens).
   - Proof of address, such as a utility bill or bank statement.

4. Submit the completed application form and supporting documents to the BNBL branch.

5. Pay the applicable fees, as specified by BNBL.

Once your application is processed and approved, you will be issued an international debit card that you can use for both domestic and international transactions. Remember to keep your card safe and protect your personal identification number (PIN) to ensure the security of your transactions. üòäüí≥

Kuzuzangpo la! The Annual Travel Scheme (ATS) is a service provided by BNB for outgoing passengers. Here's how it works:

1. Fill out the BNB ATS Form at the BNB ATS Counter, located next to the Druk Air Check-in Counters.
2. Show your departure boarding pass.
3. Deposit the Ngultrum equivalent to your BNB account as advised by the BNB Counter Staff.
4. Outgoing passengers are eligible to receive $1,000.00 in cash, and the remaining $2,000.00 will be loaded onto your BNB Debit Card.
5. To have a hassle-free travel experience, make sure to apply for your BNB Debit Card before your international travel.

If you need the ATS form, you can download it from here: [ATS Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Foreign%20Exchange/ATS%20Form.pdf)

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüëç

Can you share eligibility criteria for student loans

Certainly! Here are the eligibility criteria for student loans:

1. The student should be a Bhutanese citizen.
2. The student should have obtained an admission letter, offer letter, or eCOE (Electronic Confirmation of Enrollment) from a recognized college, university, or institute.
3. The purpose of the loan should be to meet the expenses required for pursuing higher studies, such as diploma, undergraduate, or postgraduate courses.
4. The student should be the co-applicant if the primary applicant is an individual other than the student.
5. The loan applicant should provide a copy of a valid Citizenship Identity (CID).
6. The loan applicant should provide the latest passport-sized photos of both the student and the applicant (2 nos).
7. The loan applicant should provide a copy of the admission letter or offer letter from the institute/college/university.
8. The loan applicant should provide a cost breakdown of the financing requirement, including the course fee structure.
9. For secured loans, the loan applicant should provide a copy of the ownership certificate of the property to be pledged as collateral.
10. For secured loans, the loan applicant should provide a copy of the valid insurance policy of the property (if applicable).
11. For secured loans, the loan applicant should provide a consent letter from the property owner.
12. For special education loans, additional documents such as income tax documents and NLC (Non-Liquid Collateral) documents may be required.

Please note that these are general eligibility criteria, and specific requirements may vary. It's always best to contact BNBL or visit their website for the most accurate and up-to-date information. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüéì

International bangking

Kuzuzangpo la! Thank you for your interest in BNB's international banking services. BNB offers a range of international banking solutions to cater to the needs of individuals and businesses engaged in cross-border transactions. Here are some key features of BNB's international banking services:

1. RIA Money Transfer: BNB has partnered with RIA to provide a convenient and secure way to send and receive money internationally. You can visit a BNB branch to initiate an RIA money transfer.

2. SWIFT: BNB is a member of the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT), which enables secure and efficient international fund transfers between banks worldwide.

3. MoneyGram: BNB also offers MoneyGram services, allowing you to send money directly to a bank account internationally. This service is fast, simple, and reliable.

4. Letter of Credit: BNB provides Letter of Credit services to facilitate international trade transactions. It serves as a guarantee of payment to the seller and ensures smooth and secure transactions.

5. Bills and Collections: BNB accepts and negotiates bills on behalf of customers for efficient export and import payment processing.

For more detailed information about BNB's international banking services, you can visit the International Banking section on BNB's official website: [https://bnb.bt/international-banking/]
