Will it be possible to make Bank Grantee (BG) from our OD account

Kuzuzangpo la! Yes, it is possible to make a Bank Guarantee (BG) from your OD account. You can refer to the Bank Guarantee forms provided by BNBL for more information. Here are the links to the forms:

i) For new customers: [Bank Guarantee (New Customer) form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Bank%20Guarantee/BANK%20GUARANTEE%20(New%20Customer).pdf)

ii) For existing customers: [Bank Guarantee (Existing Customer) form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Bank%20Guarantee/BANK%20GUARANTEE%20(Existing%20Customer).pdf)

iii) For extension: [Bank Guarantee (Extension) form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Bank%20Guarantee/BANK%20GUARANTEE%20(Extension).pdf)

iv) For Business Advantage Card: [Business Advantage Card form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Bank%20Guarantee/BUSINESS%20ADVANTAGE%20CARD.pdf)

If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask! üòä
which option can we choose we already having OD account at BNB But till date we have not made any BG we are using demand draft before

Aum, if you already have an OD account with BNB but have not made any Bank Guarantee (BG) before and have been using demand drafts instead, you can choose the option for "Bank Guarantee (New Customer)" when filling out the BG form. This option is suitable for customers who are applying for a Bank Guarantee for the first time.

Please note that the specific requirements and procedures may vary, so it's always a good idea to contact BNB's customer support at 6070 or visit their website for the most up-to-date information.

list of deposit products

Sure, here are some of the deposit products offered by BNBL:

1. Savings Account: A basic account that allows you to deposit and withdraw money while earning interest on your balance.

2. Current Account: Designed for frequent transactions, this account allows you to deposit and withdraw funds as needed.

3. Fixed Deposit: A deposit product where you can invest a specific amount of money for a fixed period of time at a predetermined interest rate.

4. Recurring Deposit: This product allows you to save a fixed amount of money regularly over a specific period, earning interest on your deposits.

5. NRB Account: Non-Resident Bhutanese Account (NRB) is designed for Bhutanese living abroad, allowing them to maintain accounts in Bhutanese currency.

Please note that these are just a few examples, and BNBL may offer additional deposit products. If you need more specific information or details about any of these products, feel free to ask! üòÑüè¶

Mypay and mpay

Ah, Mypay and MPay! Let me provide you with some information:

2. MPay (mpay): MPay is another digital payment service provided by BNBL. It enables you to make payments using your mobile phone. With MPay, you can transfer funds, pay bills, and make purchases at participating merchants. You can access MPay through the following link: [MPay](https://bnb.bt/mpay/)

These platforms offer convenient and secure ways to manage your payments digitally. If you have any specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüì±üí∏
I forgot my mPay Password, How can i get back?

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your MPay password, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the MPay app on your mobile phone.
2. On the login screen, tap on the "Forgot Password" option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. Follow the instructions to reset your MPay password.

Remember to choose a strong and unique password to keep your MPay account secure. If you need further assistance, you can contact our live customer support at 6070. üòäüì≤

how to send money out of bhutan

Kuzuzangpo la! To send money out of Bhutan, you can follow these steps:

1. Visit Bhutan National Bank (BNB): As a resident of Bhutan, you can visit any branch of Bhutan National Bank to initiate an outward remittance. BNB offers foreign remittance services to assist you in sending money abroad.

2. Complete the Outward Fund Transfer Form: Fill out the Outward Fund Transfer Form provided by BNB. This form will require you to provide details such as the recipient's name, bank account information, and the purpose of the remittance.

3. Provide Supporting Documents: Depending on the purpose of the remittance, you may need to provide supporting documents such as invoices, proof of education fees, or employment contracts. Make sure to have these documents ready when visiting the bank.

4. Pay the Transfer Charges: BNB will inform you about the charges associated with the foreign remittance. Make sure to pay the required fees to initiate the transfer.

5. Follow the Bank's Instructions: BNB will provide you with payment instructions, which may include downloading and filling out a SWIFT remittance form. Follow these instructions carefully and provide accurate details to ensure a smooth transfer.

6. Visit the Bank: After completing the necessary forms and providing the required documents, visit the bank in person to submit the forms and initiate the remittance.

It's important to note that the specific process and requirements may vary, so it's always a good idea to contact Bhutan National Bank directly or visit their website for the most up-to-date information.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüåü

what are the roles of the audit chief

Kuzuzangpo la! The role of the Chief, Internal Audit at Bhutan National Bank (BNB) includes the following responsibilities:

1. Overseeing Internal Audit: The Chief, Internal Audit is responsible for managing and overseeing the internal audit function within the bank. This involves conducting independent and objective assessments of the bank's operations, systems, and controls.

2. Risk Assessment: The Chief, Internal Audit identifies and assesses potential risks and vulnerabilities within the bank's processes and operations. They develop strategies to mitigate these risks and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

3. Audit Planning: The Chief, Internal Audit develops an annual audit plan based on the bank's risk profile and objectives. This plan outlines the scope, objectives, and timelines for conducting audits across various departments and functions.

4. Audit Execution: The Chief, Internal Audit leads a team of auditors in conducting audits according to the approved plan. They review financial records, internal controls, and operational processes to ensure compliance, accuracy, and efficiency.

5. Reporting and Recommendations: The Chief, Internal Audit prepares audit reports summarizing findings, recommendations, and areas for improvement. They present these reports to senior management and the Audit Committee, providing valuable insights to enhance internal controls and risk management.

Remember, these are general responsibilities, and specific duties may vary based on the bank's policies and requirements.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüåü

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to assist you. To retrieve your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will find a "Forgot TPIN" option. Tap on it.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to ensure the security of your mPay account. If you encounter any difficulties during this process, feel free to reach out to our customer support at 6070. They will be happy to assist you. üòä

list of deposit products

Sure, here are some of the deposit products offered by BNBL:

1. Savings Account: A basic account that allows you to deposit and withdraw money while earning interest on your balance.

2. Current Account: Designed for frequent transactions, this account allows you to deposit and withdraw funds as needed.

3. Fixed Deposit: A deposit product where you can invest a specific amount of money for a fixed period of time at a predetermined interest rate.

4. Recurring Deposit: This product allows you to save a fixed amount of money regularly over a specific period, earning interest on your deposits.

5. NRB Account: Non-Resident Bhutanese Account (NRB) is designed for Bhutanese living abroad, allowing them to maintain accounts in Bhutanese currency.

how do i make credit card

To apply for a credit card with BNBL, follow these steps:

1. Pick up a credit card application form from the nearest BNBL branch or download the PDF version from our website.
2. Fill out the application form completely and accurately.
3. Submit the filled-out form along with all the required documents mentioned in the checklist provided on the form.
4. Once we receive your complete application, we will conduct a credit check with other financial institutions.
5. After approval, you will be required to complete the necessary documentation as requested by the Credit Department.
6. Your credit card will be printed, and you will be notified to collect it from the nearest BNBL branch or extension office.
7. The initial validity period of the card is 5 years, and it can be renewed if required.
8. Please note that our credit cards work for both INR and USD transactions.
9. The maximum annual limit on credit cards, as per RMA regulations, is USD 1,000.00 and INR 150,000 per month. However, this limit is subject to change based on RMA approval.
10. Corporate credit cards or cards issued to students studying abroad may have higher limits, up to a maximum of USD 10,000 per year, based on RMA approvals.

If you have any further questions or need assistance with the application process, feel free to ask! üòäüéâ

How to Open Saving Account

To open a Savings Account with BNBL, follow these steps:

1. Visit the nearest BNBL branch or extension office.
2. Collect the Savings Account Opening Form (you can find the form here: [Savings Account Opening Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Saving%20Account%20Opening%20Form.pdf)).
3. Fill out the form with accurate and complete information.
4. Attach the required documents, such as your identification proof (citizenship card, passport, or voter ID), address proof, and a recent passport-sized photograph.
5. Submit the filled-out form and documents to the bank officer.
6. The bank officer will verify your information and process your application.
7. Once your application is approved, you will receive your Savings Account details, including your account number.
8. You can start depositing money into your Savings Account and enjoy the benefits of saving with BNBL.

If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüí∞

Is there a sms banking in BNB?

Kuzuzangpo la! Yes, BNB offers SMS banking services for convenient banking on the go. You can perform various transactions and inquiries through SMS. üòäüì±

To inquire about your account balance, you can use the SMS code "Bal" followed by your account number and PIN code. Here's an example:
- Send "Bal 5000045124871 1234" or "Bal 000LDGE020112 1234" to 6070.

Please note that you need to replace "5000045124871" or "000LDGE020112" with your actual account number, and "1234" with your PIN code. You will receive a response with your account balance and other relevant information.

i have not paid my loan for last 6 month, what will be the concequences

Hmm, Mashey la! If you have not paid your loan for the last 6 months, there may be consequences. Here are some possible consequences:

1. Late Payment Charges: BNB may charge late payment fees or penalties for missed loan payments. These charges can increase the overall cost of your loan.

2. Negative Credit History: Non-payment or late payment of loans can negatively impact your credit history. This can make it difficult for you to obtain future loans or credit facilities.

3. Legal Action: In extreme cases of non-payment, BNB may take legal action to recover the outstanding loan amount. This can result in legal proceedings and potential asset seizure.

It's important to contact BNB as soon as possible to discuss your situation and explore possible solutions. They may be able to provide you with options such as loan restructuring or repayment plans. Remember, it's always best to communicate with your lender to find a resolution. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask! üòäüè¶
what is restructure?

Kuzuzangpo la! Loan restructuring refers to the process of modifying the terms and conditions of an existing loan agreement. It is done to provide borrowers with more manageable repayment options when they are facing financial difficulties. Here are some key points about loan restructuring:

1. Revised Terms: The loan agreement is modified to adjust the repayment schedule, interest rate, or loan tenure. This can help reduce the monthly installment amount or extend the loan duration.

2. Financial Assessment: The lender will assess your financial situation to determine if you are eligible for loan restructuring. They will consider factors such as your income, expenses, and ability to repay the loan.

3. Application Process: To apply for loan restructuring, you will need to submit a formal request to the lender. This may require providing updated financial documents and explaining your current financial situation.

4. Approval Process: The lender will review your application and assess its feasibility. If approved, they will provide you with the revised loan terms and conditions.

Loan restructuring can be a helpful option for borrowers facing temporary financial difficulties. It allows them to adjust their loan repayment to better suit their current financial situation. If you need more specific information or assistance with loan restructuring, it's best to contact BNB directly. üìùüíº

i want to take housing loan

Kuzuzangpo la! That's great to hear that you're interested in taking a housing loan with BNBL. Our housing loan offers financing for construction, renovation, and purchase of buildings/flats for residential purposes. Here are some key details you should know:

- Maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio: 90%
- Maximum Loan Amount: 10 Million
- Maximum Tenor: 30 Years

To apply for a housing loan, you will need to meet the following eligibility criteria:
- You should be a Bhutanese citizen.
- If the repayment is to be made from business income, you need to submit a cash flow/profit & loss statement and a copy of your trade license.
- Comprehensive insurance is a must.

You will also need to submit certain documents, including a filled and signed loan application form, CID copy, passport-sized photographs, ownership certificate, site plan, approved building plan, and other relevant documents.

For more detailed information and to access the necessary forms, you can visit our website [Housing Loan](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Housing%20Loan/HOUSING%20LOAN.pdf).

If you have any specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. We're here to help you make your dream house a reality! üè°üí∞

i want loan to purchase share

Kuzuzangpo la! I apologize for the confusion earlier. If you're looking for a loan to purchase shares, BNBL does offer a loan facility for that purpose. Here are some key details you should know:

- The loan amount for the purchase of shares should not exceed 50% of the market price.
- The market price is determined by the last traded price as listed in the RSEBL (Royal Securities Exchange of Bhutan Limited).
- The maximum tenor for the loan is 5-15 years.

To apply for a loan to purchase shares, you will need to meet the following eligibility criteria:
- You should be an individual with an adequate source of income.
- You should be eligible to purchase shares.

The required documents for the loan application include a copy of your CID (both applicant and guarantor), one recent passport-sized photograph of the applicant, and proof of income to service the loan (such as verified rental income, PIT/BIT, etc.). Additionally, a trade certificate confirmation from RSEB is also required.

For more detailed information and to access the necessary forms, you can visit our website [Loan to Purchase Share](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Loan%20Against%20Shares/SHARES%20%26%20SECURITIES%20LOAN.pdf).

what is SWIFT

Kuzuzangpo la! SWIFT stands for Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication. It is a global provider of secure financial messaging services. Bhutan National Bank uses SWIFT to ensure that your financial data is transferred in a secure and safe fashion. It's like a super-fast and secure communication system for banks! üåêüí∏

i want loan to purchase share

Kuzuzangpo la! I apologize for the confusion earlier. If you're looking for a loan to purchase shares, BNBL does offer a loan facility for that purpose. Here are some key details you should know:

- The loan amount for the purchase of shares should not exceed 50% of the market price.
- The market price is determined by the last traded price as listed in the RSEBL (Royal Securities Exchange of Bhutan Limited).
- The maximum tenor for the loan is 5-15 years.

To apply for a loan to purchase shares, you will need to meet the following eligibility criteria:
- You should be an individual with an adequate source of income.
- You should be eligible to purchase shares.

The required documents for the loan application include a copy of your CID (both applicant and guarantor), one recent passport-sized photograph of the applicant, and proof of income to service the loan (such as verified rental income, PIT/BIT, etc.). Additionally, a trade certificate confirmation from RSEB is also required.

For more detailed information and to access the necessary forms, you can visit our website [Loan to Purchase Share](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Loan%20Against%20Shares/SHARES%20%26%20SECURITIES%20LOAN.pdf).

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your MyPay TPIN, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the MyPay wallet application.
2. On the login screen, click on the "Forgot TPIN" option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to keep your MyPay wallet secure. If you need further assistance, feel free to contact our live customer support at 6070. üòä

Which is more convenient Visa debit card or ru pay card

Ah, that's a great question! ü§î Both the Visa Debit Card and RuPay Card have their own advantages. Let me break it down for you:

Visa Debit Card:
- Widely accepted globally, so you can use it for international transactions.
- Offers additional benefits like travel insurance and purchase protection.
- Can be used for online shopping and making payments at various merchants.

RuPay Card:
- Accepted in India and Bhutan, making it convenient for domestic transactions.
- Offers attractive discounts and cashback offers at select merchants.
- Promotes the use of domestic payment systems.

So, the choice between Visa Debit Card and RuPay Card depends on your specific needs. If you frequently travel internationally or prefer the additional benefits, Visa Debit Card might be more suitable. On the other hand, if you primarily make domestic transactions and want to avail of discounts and offers, RuPay Card could be a better option.

Remember, it's always a good idea to consider your personal preferences and usage patterns when choosing a card. üòä

Kuzuzangpo la! Opening a savings account with Bhutan National Bank Limited (BNBL) is quite simple. Here are the steps to open a savings account:

1. Visit the nearest BNBL branch: Locate the nearest BNBL branch to your location. You can find the list of branches on our website: [BNBL Branch Locator](https://bnb.bt/contact/).

   - Duly filled in Savings Account Opening Form: You can download the form from our website: [Savings Account Opening Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Saving%20Account%20Opening%20Form.pdf).
   - Two passport-sized photographs.
   - Copy of your Citizenship Identity Card (CID).

3. Visit the branch: Take the completed application form, photographs, and CID copy to the BNBL branch.

4. Submit the documents: Submit the required documents to the bank representative at the branch.

5. Account opening process: The bank representative will guide you through the account opening process, including verifying your documents and completing the necessary paperwork.

6. Receive account details: Once your account is successfully opened, you will receive your account details, including your account number.

Congratulations! You have successfully opened a savings account with BNBL. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞üè¶
I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Mashey la, if you have forgotten your mPay TPIN, don't worry! You can easily reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.

2. On the login screen, you will find an option called "Forgot TPIN" or "Reset TPIN." Tap on that option.

3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.

4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.

5. Enter the OTP in the provided field within the mPay application.

6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be able to reset your TPIN.

7. Follow the instructions provided within the application to set a new TPIN of your choice.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to ensure the security of your mPay account.

If you encounter any difficulties during the TPIN reset process, I recommend contacting the mPay customer support helpline at 6070 for further assistance. They will be able to guide you through the process and help you regain access to your mPay account.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions. üòäüì±üí°

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no! If you have forgotten your mPAY TPIN, don't worry, I can help you with that. To reset your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPAY application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will find an option for "Forgot TPIN." Tap on that.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to ensure the security of your mPAY account. If you face any difficulties during this process, you can always contact the BNBL helpline at 6070 for further assistance. üòä

6. Receive account details: Once your account is successfully opened, you will receive your account details, including your account number.

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to help! To retrieve your mPay TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.

2. On the login screen, you will find an option called "Forgot TPIN" or "Reset TPIN." Tap on that option.

3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number and some additional verification details to confirm your identity.

4. Once you have provided the required information, the system will generate a temporary TPIN for you.

5. Use the temporary TPIN to log in to your mPay account.

6. After logging in, go to the settings or profile section of the app.

7. Look for the option to change or reset your TPIN.

8. Follow the instructions provided to set a new TPIN of your choice.

Remember to choose a TPIN that is easy for you to remember but difficult for others to guess. It's important to keep your TPIN secure to protect your account.

If you encounter any difficulties or need further assistance, you can contact our live customer support at 6070. They will be happy to assist you. üòäüì±üí°

Kuzuzangpo la! I'm delighted to assist you with your housing loan for building a house. BNBL offers a Personal Housing Loan for individuals like yourself. Here are some key details you should know:

1. Loan Amount: You can borrow up to a maximum of 90% of the Total Loan Value (LTV).
2. Maximum Loan Amount: The maximum loan amount is 10 million Bhutanese Ngultrum.
3. Maximum Tenor: You can choose a repayment period of up to 30 years.

To apply for the housing loan, you will need to fulfill the following eligibility criteria and provide the required documents:

1. Eligibility: You should be a Bhutanese citizen.
2. Documentation: You will need to submit a Loan Application form, CID copy, two passport-size photographs, Ownership Certificate (not more than 3 months old), Site Plan from the concerned Municipal Authority, Approved plan of the building, and a Letter of approval from the concerned Municipal Authority or Dzongkhag.

Additionally, if the repayment is to be made from business income, you will need to submit a Cash flow/Profit & Loss statement and a copy of your Trade License. Comprehensive Insurance for the building is also mandatory.

Please note that these are just the basic requirements, and there may be additional documents needed during the loan application process.

How to Open Saving Account

Kuzuzangpo la! Opening a savings account with Bhutan National Bank Limited (BNBL) is quite simple. Here are the steps to open a savings account:

1. Visit the nearest BNBL branch: Locate the nearest BNBL branch to your location. You can find the list of branches on our website: [BNBL Branch Locator](https://bnb.bt/contact/).

2. Gather the required documents: Make sure you have the necessary documents, including:
   - Duly filled in Savings Account Opening Form: You can download the form from our website: [Savings Account Opening Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Saving%20Account%20Opening%20Form.pdf).
   - Two passport-sized photographs.
   - Copy of your Citizenship Identity Card (CID).

3. Visit the branch: Take the completed application form, photographs, and CID copy to the BNBL branch.

4. Submit the documents: Submit the required documents to the bank representative at the branch.

5. Account opening process: The bank representative will guide you through the account opening process, including verifying your documents and completing the necessary paperwork.

6. Receive account details: Once your account is successfully opened, you will receive your account details, including your account number.

Congratulations! You have successfully opened a savings account with BNBL. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞üè¶

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your mPay TPIN, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, click on the "Forgot TPIN" option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

If you face any difficulties during this process, please feel free to ask for further assistance.

3) Education Loan: To apply for an education loan, you need to submit a loan application form, CID copies of the applicant and student, admission letter, cost breakdown of the financing requirement, and other necessary documents.

how to open my FD account

Kuzuzangpo la! Opening a Fixed Deposit (FD) account with BNBL is quite simple. Here are the steps to open an FD account:

1. Visit the nearest BNBL branch: Locate the nearest BNBL branch to your location. You can find the list of branches on our website: [BNBL Branch Locator](https://bnb.bt/contact/).

2. Gather the required documents: Make sure you have the necessary documents, including:
   - Savings Account or Current Account with BNBL.
   - Duly filled in Fixed Deposit Form: You can download the form from our website: [FD Account Opening Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Term%20Deposit%20and%20Recurring%20Deposit%20Account/TD%20or%20RD%20Form.pdf).

3. Visit the branch: Take the completed FD application form and your account details to the BNBL branch.

4. Submit the documents: Submit the required documents to the bank representative at the branch.

5. Deposit amount: Provide the desired deposit amount for your FD account.

6. Choose the tenure: Select the tenure or duration for which you want to open the FD account. It can range from a few months to several years.

7. Complete the process: The bank representative will guide you through the process, including verifying your documents and completing the necessary paperwork.

Congratulations! You have successfully opened an FD account with BNBL. Your FD account will start earning interest based on the chosen tenure. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞üè¶

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN! Don't worry, I'm here to help you out. To retrieve your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.

2. On the login screen, you will find a "Forgot TPIN" or "Reset TPIN" option. Tap on that.

3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.

4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.

5. Enter the OTP in the provided field within the application.

6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be able to reset your TPIN.

7. Follow the instructions provided in the application to set a new TPIN of your choice.

Remember to choose a strong and memorable TPIN to ensure the security of your mPay account.

If you encounter any difficulties during this process or have any further questions, please feel free to ask. I'm here to assist you! üòäüì±üí°

tell me about the loan eligibility

Kuzuzangpo la! When it comes to loan eligibility, there are certain criteria that need to be met. Here's a general overview of the loan eligibility requirements at BNBL:

1) Bhutanese Citizenship: You should be a Bhutanese citizen to be eligible for a loan.

2) Age: The minimum age requirement is usually 18 years, but it may vary depending on the type of loan. Some loans may have a maximum age limit as well.

3) Income and Employment: Your income and employment status play a crucial role in loan eligibility. You may be required to provide proof of income, such as salary slips or business financial statements.

4) Credit History: Your credit history and credit score are considered to assess your creditworthiness. A good credit history increases your chances of loan approval.

5) Collateral: Depending on the type and amount of the loan, collateral may be required. Collateral can be in the form of property, vehicles, or other assets.

It's important to note that these are general eligibility criteria, and specific requirements may vary for different types of loans. To get detailed information about the eligibility criteria for a specific loan, it's best to visit the nearest BNBL branch or contact our customer support at 6070.

Remember, meeting the eligibility criteria doesn't guarantee loan approval. The final decision is subject to the bank's assessment and policies.

- Comprehensive insurance is a must.

You will also need to submit certain documents, including a filled and signed loan application form, CID copy, passport-sized photographs, ownership certificate, site plan, approved building plan, and other relevant documents.

For more detailed information and to access the necessary forms, you can visit our website [Housing Loan](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Housing%20Loan/HOUSING%20LOAN.pdf).

If you have any specific questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. We're here to help you make your dream house a reality! üè°üí∞

i want loan to purchase share

Kuzuzangpo la! I apologize for the confusion earlier. If you're looking for a loan to purchase shares, BNBL does offer a loan facility for that purpose. Here are some key details you should know:

- The loan amount for the purchase of shares should not exceed 50% of the market price.
- The market price is determined by the last traded price as listed in the RSEBL (Royal Securities Exchange of Bhutan Limited).
- The maximum tenor for the loan is 5-15 years.

To apply for a loan to purchase shares, you will need to meet the following eligibility criteria:
- You should be an individual with an adequate source of income.
- You should be eligible to purchase shares.

The required documents for the loan application include a copy of your CID (both applicant and guarantor), one recent passport-sized photograph of the applicant, and proof of income to service the loan (such as verified rental income, PIT/BIT, etc.). Additionally, a trade certificate confirmation from RSEB is also required.

For more detailed information and to access the necessary forms, you can visit our website [Loan to Purchase Share](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Loan%20Against%20Shares/SHARES%20%26%20SECURITIES%20LOAN.pdf).

If you have any further questions or need assistance with the loan application process, feel free to ask. Happy investing! üìàüí∞

types of loan

Ah, loans! We have a variety of loan options available at BNBL. Here are some of the types of loans we offer:

1) Education Loan: This loan is designed to support your higher education expenses, such as tuition fees, books, and accommodation.

2) Home Loan: If you're planning to buy or construct a house, our home loan can help you finance your dream home.

3) Vehicle Loan: Need a new car or motorcycle? Our vehicle loan can provide you with the necessary funds to purchase your desired vehicle.

4) Personal Loan: Whether it's for a wedding, medical expenses, or any personal need, our personal loan can provide you with the financial assistance you require.

5) Business Loan: If you're an entrepreneur or a business owner, our business loan can help you expand your business or meet your working capital needs.

6) Agriculture Loan: For farmers and individuals involved in agricultural activities, our agriculture loan can provide financial support for farming equipment, livestock, and other agricultural needs.

These are just a few examples of the loan types we offer. Each loan has its own eligibility criteria and requirements. If you have a specific loan in mind or need more information about a particular loan type, please let me know! üòäüíºüí∞

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to help! To reset your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will find a "Forgot TPIN" option. Tap on it.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field and proceed.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to ensure the security of your mPay account. If you encounter any difficulties during this process, you can always contact our live customer support at 6070 for further assistance. üòä
Which account will earn me more money fd or rd

Hmm, Mashey la, that's a great question! Both Fixed Deposit (FD) and Recurring Deposit (RD) accounts are great options for earning money through interest. However, the amount of money you can earn will depend on various factors such as the deposit amount, duration, and interest rates offered by the bank.

In general, Fixed Deposit (FD) accounts tend to offer higher interest rates compared to Recurring Deposit (RD) accounts. This is because FDs require a lump sum deposit for a fixed period of time, allowing the bank to offer a higher interest rate.

On the other hand, Recurring Deposit (RD) accounts allow you to make regular monthly deposits over a fixed period of time. While the interest rates for RDs may be slightly lower, they still provide a steady and consistent way to grow your savings.

To determine which account will earn you more money, it's important to consider your financial goals, the amount you can deposit, and the duration you are willing to commit to. You can also check the current interest rates for both FDs and RDs offered by BNBL on our website or contact our live customer support at 6070 for more specific information.

Remember, it's always a good idea to consult with a financial advisor or bank representative to understand which option aligns best with your financial needs and goals. üòäüí∞üè¶

Kuzuzangpo la! If you have forgotten your mPay TPIN, you can reset it by following these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, click on the "Forgot TPIN" option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

If you face any difficulties during this process, please feel free to ask for further assistance.

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to help! To reset your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will find a "Forgot TPIN" option. Tap on it.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field and proceed.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

Remember to choose a strong and unique TPIN to ensure the security of your mPay account. If you face any difficulties during this process, you can always contact our live customer support at 6070 for further assistance. üòäüì±

Of course, I'd be happy to tell you about the CXOs mentioned in the information you provided! The CXOs mentioned are Chief Banking Operations Officer, Chief Corporate Services Officer, and Chief Customer Experience Officer. These positions report directly to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Bhutan National Bank Limited (BNBL). Each CXO oversees different verticals or functions within the bank.

The Chief Banking Operations Officer oversees the Branch Operations Department, Finance Department, IT Operations Department, and Remedial Department. They are responsible for driving the bank's credit management strategy, supervising the bank's IT systems, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.

The Chief Corporate Services Officer oversees the Human Resources and Administration Department and the Digital Transformation Department. They drive the company's financial planning, HR plans, and change in the bank's business models.

The Chief Customer Experience Officer oversees the Customer Service Department and drives the bank's customer service systems and marketing strategy. They play a crucial role in enhancing the overall customer experience.

These CXO positions require a minimum bachelor's degree and at least 15 years of work experience, with at least 5 years of experience leading a department or organization. The contract tenure for each position varies, and the salary and benefits are provided as per the bank's HR policy.

I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to help you out! To retrieve your mPay TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPay application on your mobile device.

2. On the login screen, you will find an option called "Forgot TPIN" or "Reset TPIN." Tap on that option.

3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.

4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.

5. Enter the OTP in the provided field within the mPay application.

6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be prompted to set a new TPIN for your mPay account.

7. Choose a new TPIN that is easy for you to remember but difficult for others to guess.

8. Confirm the new TPIN and save the changes.

And voila! You have successfully reset your mPay TPIN. Now you can log in to your mPay account using the new TPIN. If you encounter any difficulties during this process or have any other questions, feel free to ask. üòäüîêüì±

So what is an extension office

Kuzuzangpo la! An extension office is a smaller branch of a bank that is established in a specific location to provide banking services to customers in that area. It serves as a convenient and accessible point for customers who may not have easy access to the main branch. Extension offices typically offer services such as account opening, cash deposits and withdrawals, loan applications, and other basic banking transactions. I forgot my mPay TPIN, How can i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your mPAY TPIN! Don't worry, I'm here to help you out. To retrieve your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the mPAY application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will see an option called "Forgot TPIN." Tap on that option.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field.
6. Once the OTP is verified, you will be able to reset your TPIN.
7. Follow the instructions on the screen to set a new TPIN of your choice.

If you face any difficulties during this process or if you have any other questions, feel free to reach out to the mPAY customer support team at 6070. They will be happy to assist you further.

Remember to keep your TPIN secure and avoid sharing it with anyone. üòäüì±

How to Open Saving Account

Kuzuzangpo la! Opening a savings account with Bhutan National Bank Limited (BNBL) is quite simple. Here are the steps to open a savings account:

1. Visit the nearest BNBL branch: Locate the nearest BNBL branch to your location. You can find the list of branches on our website: [BNBL Branch Locator](https://bnb.bt/branch-locator/).

2. Gather the required documents: Make sure you have the necessary documents, including:
   - Duly filled in Savings Account Opening Form: You can download the form from our website: [Savings Account Opening Form](https://bnb.bt/wp-content/uploads/dld/FORMS/Account%20Opening%20Forms/Savings%20Account/Saving%20Account%20Opening%20Form.pdf).
   - Two passport-sized photographs.
   - Copy of your Citizenship Identity Card (CID).

3. Visit the branch: Take the completed application form, photographs, and CID copy to the BNBL branch.

4. Submit the documents: Submit the required documents to the bank representative at the branch.

5. Account opening process: The bank representative will guide you through the account opening process, including verifying your documents and completing the necessary paperwork.

6. Receive account details: Once your account is successfully opened, you will receive your account details, including your account number.

Congratulations! You have successfully opened a savings account with BNBL. If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞üè¶

What do we need for education loan?

Kuzuzangpo la! To apply for an education loan, you will need the following documents:

1) Duly filled in loan application form signed by the applicant.
2) Duly filled in student details form signed by the student.
3) Copy of valid Citizenship Identity (CID) of the applicant and the student.
4) Latest passport-sized photos of the student and the applicant (2 nos).
5) Copy of admission letter/offer letter from the institute/college/university.
6) Cost breakdown of the financing requirement, including the course fee structure.
7) Copy of ownership certificate of the property to be pledged as collateral (if applicable).
8) Copy of valid insurance policy of the property (if applicable).
9) Consent letter from the property owner.
10) Latest passport-sized photo of the property owner.
11) Copy of valid Citizenship Identity (CID) of the property owner

So let's say i open an rd account for 1 year deposit nu.500 monthly. What will be the amount i will get at the end of the duration?

Kuzuzangpo la! That's a great question. To calculate the maturity amount of your recurring deposit (RD) account, we need to consider the deposit amount, the duration, and the interest rate.

Let's assume you open an RD account for 1 year with a monthly deposit of Nu. 500. According to the provided information, the interest rate for a 1-year deposit is 7.00% per annum.

To calculate the maturity amount, we can use the formula:

Maturity Amount = Monthly Deposit √ó [((1 + Interest Rate/100)^(Number of Quarters) - 1) / (Interest Rate/100)]

In this case, the number of quarters for 1 year is 4.

Using the formula, the maturity amount would be:

Maturity Amount = 500 √ó [((1 + 7.00/100)^(4) - 1) / (7.00/100)]

Please note that this is a simplified calculation and does not take into account any additional factors or fees. For a more accurate calculation, I would recommend contacting the bank's customer support or visiting the nearest branch.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask. üòäüí∞üè¶

What do we need for education loan?

1) Duly filled in loan application form signed by the applicant.

3) Copy of valid Citizenship Identity (CID) of the applicant and the student.
4) Latest passport-sized photos of the student and the applicant (2 nos).
5) Copy of admission letter/offer letter from the institute/college/university.
6) Cost breakdown of the financing requirement, including the course fee structure.

Interest rates

Ah, interest rates! A topic that can make anyone's head spin. But don't worry, I'm here to help you out! Bhutan National Bank offers different interest rates for various accounts and products. Let me break it down for you:

1. Fixed Deposit Interest Rates: The interest rates for fixed deposits vary based on the deposit period. You can find the specific rates on the Bhutan National Bank website under the "Interest Rates" section. Just click here [https://bnb.bt/Interest-Rates] to check them out.

2. Savings Account Interest Rates: For regular savings accounts, the interest rate is 4.50% per annum. However, if you have a Piggy Bank Account, the interest rate is slightly higher at 5.00% per annum. Pensioner's Account also offers an interest rate of 4.50% per annum. And if you have a Savings Provident Fund (PF) Account, you can enjoy a higher interest rate of 6.50% per annum.

3. Non-Resident Bhutanese Foreign Currency (NRBFC) Savings Account: If you have an NRBFC Savings Account, the interest rates vary based on the currency. For example, the interest rate for AUD is 2.00% per annum, for JPY it's 0.75% per annum, and for USD, SGD, CAD, Euro, GBP, CHF, and HKD, it's 0.75% per annum.

Please note that these rates are subject to change, so it's always a good idea to check the latest rates on the Bhutan National Bank website or contact their customer support at 6070 for the most up-to-date information.

Savings Provident Fund (PF) Account
What's the difference between this account and a regular bnb account

Ah, I see you're curious about the difference between a Savings Provident Fund (PF) Account and a regular BNB account. Well, let me explain it to you in a jiffy!

The main difference lies in the purpose and features of these two types of accounts. A regular BNB savings account is designed for individuals to deposit their money and earn interest on their savings. It's a general-purpose account that allows you to manage your day-to-day banking needs, such as making deposits, withdrawals, and accessing various banking services like ATM, internet banking, and more.

On the other hand, a Savings PF Account is specifically tailored for individuals who want to contribute to their Provident Fund (PF). The PF is a retirement savings scheme where a portion of your salary is deducted and deposited into the PF account. This account helps you save for your future and build a nest egg for your retirement.

The Savings PF Account offers a higher interest rate compared to a regular savings account, which encourages individuals to save more for their retirement. It may also have specific terms and conditions related to the PF scheme, such as withdrawal restrictions and eligibility criteria.

So, in a nutshell, while a regular BNB account is for general savings and banking needs, a Savings PF Account is specifically designed for individuals who want to contribute to their Provident Fund and save for their retirement.

If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask! I'm here to help. üòäüè¶

Alright thanks! Now what is the difference between debit card and credit card

Ah, the age-old question of the difference between debit cards and credit cards! Well, let me break it down for you, my dear friend.

A debit card is like a magical key that gives you direct access to your own money. When you use a debit card, the purchase amount is deducted directly from your bank account. It's like using cash, but in a more convenient and electronic form. So, you can only spend what you have in your account. No borrowing involved!

On the other hand, a credit card is like having a little financial genie in your pocket. When you use a credit card, you're essentially borrowing money from the bank or credit card issuer to make your purchase. You'll receive a monthly bill for the amount you've spent, and you have the option to pay it off in full or make minimum payments over time. But remember, if you don't pay off the full amount, you may be charged interest on the remaining balance. So, it's important to use credit cards responsibly and manage your payments wisely.

Both debit cards and credit cards can be used for online and in-person purchases, and they often come with additional features like rewards programs, fraud protection, and the ability to build credit history (which can be helpful for future financial endeavors).

If you want to learn more about the specific features and benefits of debit cards and credit cards offered by Bhutan National Bank, you can visit their website at [https://bnb.bt] and explore the "Cards" section.

Remember, my friend, it's important to choose the card that suits your financial needs and spending habits. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòÑüí≥
Which one is preffered?
Which one is preffered?

Ah, the eternal debate of debit cards versus credit cards! Well, my dear friend, the preferred choice between debit cards and credit cards really depends on your personal financial situation and spending habits.

If you prefer to have more control over your spending and want to avoid the temptation of borrowing money, a debit card may be the preferred option for you. With a debit card, you can only spend what you have in your bank account, helping you stay within your budget and avoid accumulating debt.

On the other hand, if you're looking for additional financial flexibility, the ability to earn rewards, and the opportunity to build credit history, a credit card may be the preferred choice. Credit cards can offer perks like cashback, travel rewards, and purchase protection. Plus, responsible use of a credit card can help you establish a positive credit history, which can be beneficial for future financial endeavors like applying for loans or mortgages.

Ultimately, it's important to choose the card that aligns with your financial goals and spending habits. Some people even choose to have both a debit card and a credit card to enjoy the benefits of both worlds!

If you're still unsure which option is best for you, I recommend speaking with a financial advisor or contacting Bhutan National Bank's customer support at 6070. They'll be able to provide personalized guidance based on your specific needs.

Remember, my friend, the key is to use whichever card you choose responsibly and within your means. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòäüí≥

They can be used for various purposes, such as starting a new business, expanding an existing business, purchasing equipment, or managing working capital. i forgot my mpay TPIN how do i get back?

Oh no, it seems like you've forgotten your MPay TPIN. Don't worry, I'm here to help! To reset your TPIN, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the MyPay wallet application on your mobile device.
2. On the login screen, you will find a "Forgot TPIN" option. Tap on it.
3. You will be prompted to enter your registered mobile number.
4. After entering your mobile number, you will receive an OTP (One-Time Password) on your registered mobile number.
5. Enter the OTP in the provided field and proceed.
6. You will then be able to reset your TPIN and set a new one.

If you face any difficulties during this process, you can always contact our live customer support at 6070 for further assistance. Remember to keep your TPIN secure and avoid sharing it with anyone.

To apply for a loan with Bhutan National Bank, you can follow these steps:

1. Visit the BNBL website: [https://bnb.bt/](https://bnb.bt/)
2. Navigate to the "Loans" section on the website.
3. Choose the type of loan you are interested in, such as personal loan or business loan.
4. Click on the loan type to access more information about the loan.
5. Review the eligibility criteria, required documents, and loan terms.
6. If you meet the requirements, you can download the loan application form from the website.
7. Fill out the application form with accurate information.
8. Gather all the necessary supporting documents as mentioned in the loan application form.
9. Visit your nearest BNBL branch and submit the completed application form along with the required documents.
10. The bank will review your application and assess your eligibility for the loan.
11. If approved, you will be notified about the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment terms.
12. Sign the loan agreement and complete any additional formalities as required by the bank.
13. Once all the formalities are completed, the loan amount will be disbursed to your designated account.

Please note that the loan approval process may vary depending on the type of loan and individual circumstances. It is always recommended to contact BNBL directly or visit your nearest branch for more detailed information and personalized assistance.

If you have any further questions or need assistance, feel free to ask.

what is interest

Interest, in the context of finance, refers to the cost of borrowing money or the return earned on an investment. It is typically expressed as a percentage of the principal amount. When you borrow money, such as taking out a loan, you are required to pay back the borrowed amount plus an additional amount known as interest. This is the cost of using the lender's funds. On the other hand, when you invest your money, you may earn interest on that investment, which is the return you receive for lending your funds to someone else. Interest rates can vary depending on factors such as the prevailing market conditions, the creditworthiness of the borrower, and the duration of the loan or investment.

Open Saving Account

Kuzuzangpo! I'm glad to hear that you're interested in opening a savings account with Bhutan National Bank Limited. Our savings account is available for all Bhutanese nationals above the age of 15 years. Additionally, in some special circumstances, firms, corporations, and government agencies are also allowed to operate a savings account.

The features of our savings account include:
- No minimum balance required to open and maintain the account
- No restriction on the maximum balance
- An annual account maintenance fee of Nu. 150.00 only
- No limit on withdrawals to earn interest
- Free cheque book, ATM card, Internet Banking, SMS facility, and B-wallet service

To open a savings account, you will need to fulfill the eligibility criteria and provide the required documents. The eligibility includes being an individual, opening an account on behalf of a minor, or representing national and international non-government organizations, religious bodies/organizations, trusts, societies, foundations, associations, community-based organizations, or educational institutions.

The required documents for a pensioner savings account include:
- Duly filled application form
- Two passport size photographs
- Copy of your Citizenship Identity card
- Letter from the National Pension and Provident Fund (NPPF) office

If you have any further questions or need assistance with opening a savings account, please let me know.

How can i avail share loan?

To avail a share loan, you can follow the steps provided by BNB. First, you need to ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria, which includes having a reliable source of income and being eligible to purchase shares. Then, you can gather the required documents, such as a copy of your CID, a recent passport-size photograph, and proof of income to service the loan. Once you have all the necessary documents, you can contact BNB and inquire about the loan application process. They will guide you through the process and provide you with the necessary forms and information.
what is the interest rate of the share loan?

According to the information provided, BNB offers a floating and a fixed interest rate for share loans. The fixed interest rate is 12.5%, while the floating interest rate is 11%. You can choose the interest rate option that suits you best.
what are the features of share loan

The features of the share loan offered by BNB include:

1. Loan Amount: The loan amount for the purchase of shares should not exceed 50% of the market price or offer price, whichever is lower at that point in time. The market price is derived from the lowest of the last three years' traded price.

2. Maximum Tenor: The maximum tenor for the share loan is 5 years.

3. Eligibility: The share loan is available to individual customers who have an adequate source of income and are eligible to purchase shares.

Please note that these are the features mentioned in the provided information. If you require more specific details, it is advisable to contact BNB directly for further clarification.
how can i get my vichile loan

To obtain a vehicle loan, you can follow the process outlined by BNB. First, ensure that you meet the eligibility criteria, which includes being a Bhutanese citizen. Then, gather the required documents, such as a filled loan application form, a copy of your CID, a recent passport-size photograph, and a copy of the quotation or invoice for the new vehicle from an authorized dealer.

Additionally, depending on the type of vehicle you are seeking a loan for, there are specific conditions and maximum loan-to-value (LTV) ratios set by the Royal Monetary Authority (RMA). For example, for a personal vehicle, the maximum LTV is 30%, while for an electric vehicle, it is 70%. You will need to provide fixed assets to the extent of the loan amount, have a guarantor with fixed assets and a good credit record, or ensure that the loan amount is within the specified percentage of the vehicle cost.

Once you have all the necessary documents and meet the eligibility criteria, you can submit your loan application to BNB. They will review your application and guide you through the loan approval process. It is important to note that comprehensive insurance is mandatory for vehicle loans.

Please keep in mind that the information provided is based on the details given, and it is advisable to contact BNB directly for any specific queries or further assistance regarding your vehicle loan application.

why slow in transition while using mpay

There could be several reasons for slow transactions while using BNB mPAY. Some possible factors could include:

1. Network Issues: Slow internet connectivity or network congestion can affect the speed of transactions.

2. Technical Glitches: Technical issues within the app or on the server side can cause delays in processing transactions.

3. High Transaction Volumes: During peak hours or busy periods, a high volume of transactions can slow down the overall processing time.

4. Mobile Service Provider: Data charges from your mobile service provider may apply, and if there are any issues with their network, it can impact the speed of transactions.

It is recommended to ensure that you have a stable internet connection and try conducting transactions during off-peak hours to potentially avoid any slowdowns. If you continue to experience slow transactions, it is advisable to reach out to Bhutan National Bank directly for further assistance and clarification on the matter.
